duck: Heterosexism - Heterosexism is a system of attitudes, bias, and discrimination in favor of opposite-sex sexuality and relationships.

Heteroflexible - Heteroflexibility is a form of a sexual orientation or situational sexual behavior characterized by minimal homosexual activity despite a primarily heterosexual sexual orientation that is consid...
heterosexuality definition: of, relating to, or characterized by a tendency to direct sexual desire toward the opposite sex.
Heterosexuality is romantic attraction, sexual attraction or sexual behavior between persons of opposite sex or gender in the gender binary.
Breeder (slang) - Breeder is a derogative term for people that have children (or heterosexuals in general).
Queer heterosexuality - Queer heterosexuality describes heterosexual practice that is queer.
Heterosexuality is romantic attraction, sexual attraction or sexual behavior between persons of opposite sex or gender in the gender binary.

wiki.text:
'Heterosexuality' is romantic attraction, sexual attraction or sexual behavior
between persons of opposite sex or gender in the gender binary.<!-- NOTE: "Sex"
and "gender" are not always the same thing; for example, "sex" may refer to
"biological sex" (being male or female), while "gender" may refer to a person's
gender identity of being a man or a woman; therefore, like the Sexual
orientation, Homosexuality and Bisexuality articles, we have included both in
the lead. --> As a sexual orientation, heterosexuality refers to "an enduring
pattern of or disposition to experience sexual, affectionate, physical or
romantic attractions to persons of the opposite sex"; it also refers to "an
individual’s sense of personal and social identity based on those attractions,
behaviors expressing them, and membership in a community of others who share
them".<ref name="apahelp"></ref><ref name="brief">[http://www.courtinfo.ca.gov/-
courts/supreme/highprofile/documents/Amer_Psychological_Assn_Amicus_Curiae_Brie-
f.pdf APA California Amicus Brief.]</ref> The term is usually applied to humans,
but it is also observed in all mammals.

Heterosexuality is one of the three main classifications of sexual orientation
along with bisexuality and homosexuality, which are each parts of the
heterosexual–homosexual continuum.

The word is etymologically formed by adding the combining form of Greek έτερος
heteros (meaning "different" or "other") as a prefix to "sexuality".
wiki.title: heterosexuality
